column4: i just created a user, added them to `admin and now when i login with that user, it seems that the termincal colors are turned off... is there a way to grant that to the user or group of `admin`?
how did you create the user perhaps they didn't get skeleton files for .bashrc etc... from /etc/skel
should have copied but take a look in your /home/someprimetime and ls -lah
did that.. drwxr-xr-x 7 root root 4.0K Aug 31 08:24 public_html
yeah you are missing the default files.. copy them out of /etc/skel/  to your users home
you could do something like cp -r /etc/skel/. /home/someprimetime/   should copy the hidden files over
or i guess a more proper solution would be cp -a /etc/skel/* /home/someprimetime  but either way
ignore that last response that won't work
what are the permissions of their home directory and the .viminfo file?
what did you do create a new user with a home on a mounted partition?
i was on root and created a new user with useradd added them to the admin group then opened `visudo` and added them specifically to the bottom with someprimetime ALL=(ALL) ALL
you could have just added them to the sudo group on ubuntu and they would have sudo access
ah should i change what i did and do that instead ?
doesn't matter either way it's just a default group and sudo setup in ubuntu. just add someprimetime to the sudo group and sudo visudo and remove the line you put in there.
